text:
Michelle, Daphne, and Mukesh are officers of the Mystery Club. Mukesh designs a flyer to attract new members.

Daphne is making a large poster to publicize the next meeting. She wants to redraw the club’s logo, Super Sleuth, in a larger size.

Michelle shows her a clever way to make an image of the figure by using rubber bands.

Make a Prediction

How will the image compare to the original figure? What might change? What might stay the same?

Equipment

  • rubber bands – identical size, bands about 3 inches long work well
  • a shape to enlarge and anchor point
  • blank paper
  • tape

Directions

  • Make a “two-band stretcher” by tying the ends of the rubber bands together.
  • Tape the Learning Aid to your desk. Next to it, tape a blank sheet of paper.
  • If you are right-handed, put the blank paper on the right. If you are left-handed, put the blank paper on the left.

tiles.title: Setup for using a rubber band stretcher

text:
• With your finger, hold down one end of the rubber-band stretcher on point P. Point P is called the anchor point.
  • Put a pencil in the other hand of the stretcher. Stretch the rubber bands with the pencil until the knot is on the outline of the shape.
  • Keep the rubber bands taut (stretched). Move your pencil to guide the knot around the picture. Your pencil will draw a copy of the shape. The new picture is called the image of the original. It is also a scale drawing of the original.

• Use the rubber-band method to enlarge the figure on the Mystery Club flyer.
  • Draw the figure as carefully as you can, so you can compare the size and shape of the image to the original figure.

Analyze the Data

  • How are the original figure and its image alike? Different? What is your evidence?

supports.text: How do the lengths of line segments compare between the two figures?
How do the areas of the two figures compare?
How do the angles of the two figures compare?
